text: Christopher Michael Pitcher (born 26 August 1973) is an English former first- class cricketer. Pitcher was born at Croydon in August 1973 and later studied at Selwyn College, Cambridge. While studying at Cambridge, he made his debut in first-class cricket for Cambridge University against Leicestershire at Fenner's in 1992. He played first-class cricket for Cambridge until 1994, making 24 appearances. Pitcher scored a total of 226 runs in his 24 matches for Cambridge, at an average of 10.76 and a high score of 43. With his right- arm medium pace bowling, he took 37 wickets at a high average of 54.45, with best figures of 4 for 37. He also made a first-class appearance for the Combined Universities cricket team against the touring New Zealanders in 1994. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1973 births Category:Living people Category:People from Croydon Category:Alumni of Trinity College, Cambridge Category:English cricketers Category:Cambridge University cricketers Category:British Universities cricketers
title: Christopher Pitcher
